definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)

sentences.english: LCD screen display, man-machine dialogue, graphic display interface.
sentences.chinese: 液晶屏幕显示，人机对话，图形显示界面。

sentences.english: A dramatic example would be shooting LCD screens.
sentences.chinese: 一个戏剧性的例子是射击液晶屏幕。

sentences.english: The change of bag-making length is set through liquid crystal screen, and no need to replace the roll.
sentences.chinese: 改变制袋长度由液晶屏设定，无需更换版辊。

sentences.english: We just bought a new TV with a LCD screen.
sentences.chinese: 我们刚刚买了台新电视，是液晶屏的。

sentences.english: Station information can be displayed on the LCD screen, the patient can gain the shifting station time at the right moment.
sentences.chinese: 将台位信息显示在液晶屏上，及时提醒患者换台时间。

sentences.english: They would also use far less power than the liquid-crystal displays that are now standard on most computers.
sentences.chinese: 比起现在流行的液晶屏，他们应该更节能。

sentences.english: But for most of the shows people watch, LCD screens use significantly less electricity.
sentences.chinese: 但对于看电视的人而言，液晶屏幕明显更加省电。

sentences.english: He had no choice, and turned to see the LCD screen of display.
sentences.chinese: 别无选择，他回过头看着显示器的液晶屏幕。

sentences.english: What is the LCD screen of the Dead?
The maximum effect would turn the LCD screen completely dark.
sentences.chinese: 的最大影响将打开液晶屏幕全黑了。

sentences.english: The black mark on the right side is the effect of the lamp burning the LCD screen.
sentences.chinese: 在右边的黑色标志，是燃烧着的液晶屏幕灯的效果。

sentences.english: But LCDs are much more battery-hungry and are not so easy on the eye when reading for long periods.
sentences.chinese: 但液晶屏极耗电池，长时间阅读容易视觉疲劳。

sentences.english: The LCD panel displays the exposure compensation value also.
sentences.chinese: 液晶屏幕也将显示曝光补偿值。

definition: button or key (on a device)/keystroke/CL:個|个[ge4]/to press a button
to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)
